title: Biden Climate-Change Plans Gain Momentum as Democrats Retool Agenda
sub_head: Tax breaks for low-carbon electricity emerge as core of fiscal plan that could get through Congress
body:
WASHINGTON—President Biden’s climate-change plan, particularly enhanced tax incentives for renewable energy, is very much alive in Congress—even as other important pieces of his economic-policy agenda appear dead.
Democrats will soon try to reconstruct legislation from the ashes of the roughly $2 trillion Build Back Better bill that passed the House in November but collapsed in the Senate after opposition from Sen. Joe Manchin (D., W.Va.).
